Blog.post: You may be wondering why I have been absent recently. I went to Florida, and not to Orlando or the beaches either. Day 1 Wednesday: We left at 7:30 PM Eastern Daylight Time, due to having to find a baby sitter for our driver's 3 oldest kids Day 2 Thursday: We arrived in Citra, Florida at precisely 3:00 AM. I went to bed at 7 AM, woke up at 9:30 AM, and did practically nothing but play on my Game Boy Color and Nintendo 64 (the only 2 civilized equipment I was allowed to bring. We even to haul down our own television, which kept tripping the circuits). Day 3 Friday: This is when things started to get interesting. Our driver (name not disclosed due to obvious reasons) had outstanding misdeamor arrest warrants in Florida. Someone named Bob reported that he had returned to Florida jurisdiction. Thank the Lord that he was at the grocery store for us. Well, we had to high tail it to Branford, Florida. It took us 3 hours to go on a 1 hour trip since my gramma's car kept breaking down. Day 4 Saturday: We stayed in Branford, Florida at my gramma's place. Day 5 Sunday: We left Branford at 11:30 AM EDT and arrived at 4:30 PM EDT back home in Marietta, GA. Well, that's all folks. Disclaimer: The above recount is 100% accurate. Full names are not given to protect the not so innocent and innocent alike, since the not so innocent is still fairly innocent as the warrant is for violation of probabation, and he broke it by moving to Marietta, Georgia.

I absolutely love this French band called Leadspine. Very good band. One of my most favourite songs in the world has to be "We're All Made of Scars" by them. Oh, did I mention that I'm friends with their guitarrist? Well, listen to them. urlLink Visit Leadspine today . Tinsel Music Rating System Artist: Leadspine Genre: Modern Soft Rock Sounds like: U2, R.E.M., Matchbox Twenty Rating: * * * * (On a Scale of 5) Disclaimer: The views contained within are not the views of the whole of Tinsel, but only the contributing writer of this article.

Parents mourn India fire victims How can any self respecting teacher live with that? It's so so sad. I hope those 23 teachers die a very panful death, and soon. Hang them, and while they are hanging and still alive, burn them. I know that's the wrong thing to say, but I truly feel that should happen.

Ah, I just watched the first ever episode of urlLink Stargate: Atlantis on the Sci Fi channel. It was awesome. I loved it. It comes on Friday nights at 9 / 8 Central. You should watch it. Well, how was the first episode? Well, they need to find a person who can naturally control the technology of the ancients. Then, they find that guy in Major Sheppard. Then, the dial Atlantis, and find it abandoned. Well, bla bla bla. You get the point. In the end, it was well worth it. Ya'll just gotta catch the rerun. I only ruined the first couple of minutes of it.

Greatest movie ever: urlLink Mystic River . I absolutely loved it. Great director, Clint Eastwood. 3 great actors play the main characters, Jimmy, Sean, & Dave. Just watch it, and you'll see why I love it so much. I just got done watching it (yes, at 12:45 AM).

Today is the wonderful second day of Tinsel, the most rocking Blogging project out there. Well, how is everything going so far? Just wonderful. Oh yes, we are so gonna rock. Well, some news in the world, just for the hell of it: Iraqi now has a new intelligence agency designed to fight the insurgency of rebellious people within the country, killing both American soldiers, Iraqi police, and other Iraqi citizens. You can read about its creation at both urlLink CNN and urlLink Al-Jazeera.net (English Edition) I hope everything goes well for Iraq in the end personally.

Tinsel is graciously hosted free of charge by XionDigital.net (considering one of the co-founders, myself, owns the place :-D). However, I have exactly 60 days to renew my plan before XionDigital.net (and Tinsel!) goes offline. However, I only need a measly $100, yes that's right, $100, to keep us online for yet another year! If you have some spare money to blow and feel like contributing, please email urlLink Justin Haygood , and he will let you know how to contribute to the fund. Justin will refuse all donations after the $100 goal is reached.
Do you want to become a contributor to the Tinsel Blogging Project? urlLink Email Us and ask to join. Tinsel is so gonna rock!

Tinsel is a joint blogging project between myself and Justin (jhaygood86). Hopefully this will be a successful venture that will prove to be amusing as all hell. As an introduction I will essentially introduce myself, as I'm sure Justin can speak for himself perfectly well. You'll most likely be able to tell my posts apart from his easily. First off, I tend to rammble on for great amounts of time about nonconscensical things and my spelling and grammar are horrid. I also tend to spout band propaganda every five sentences (Go and check out Mae's website: urlLink http://www.whatismae.com . It's muchly worth the visit. There's not really much else to say about me other then my real first name is Meagan, and I also have a livejournal account ( urlLink http://www.livejournal.com/users/porcelain303 ) Yes, that's all for now folks check back again or post your own thoughts and comments. (Just for the records all my posts will end with the following lines) Smack an ass, Meagan

Hey! My name is Justin Haygood. I live in Marietta, GA. I am 16 years old. I goto Marietta High School, and will start the 11th grade on August 11, 2003. Note: I am currently on summer break. I am a computer geek/nerd/etc..., and can fix any computer. Have a problem with yours? Just conatact me by email (jhaygood86@msn.com)

Look At What I'm attempting to build: A Brand Spanking New Powerhouse! (Computer) CPU: AMD Athlon 64 2800+ Motherboard: Soyo CK8 Dragon Plus (nVIDIA nForce 3 150 chipset) Case: Diablotek Black Demon ATX Power Supply: Ultra 500 Watt ATX RAM: 3 X Premium 512MB PC2100 DDR Graphics Card: XFXForce GeForce FX 5700 LE Harddrives: 2 X Seagate 120 GB EIDE ATA/100 7200 RPM DVD Burner: TDK DVD +/- R/RW 4X2X12X CD Burner: Dominator CD Burner 52X24X52X Floppy: Generic Black Floppy Drive Monitor: Dell E773C 17" CRT Video Input: AVerMedia UltraTV PCI 350 Speaker: Logitech Z640 Dolby 5.1 6 Speaker OS: Windows XP Professional OEM Office: Microsoft Office 2003 Standard for Students and Teachers DVD Codec: WinDVD OEM Mouse: Logitech MX310 Optical Keyboard: Logitech Elite Keyboard Total Price: $2,007.91 (including shipping)

I just got done with my newest creation, the urlLink NXOnline Advanced Internet Design website. If you are in the market for a website, a webhost for a website, or a programmer to add brains to a website, please consider using NXOnline. I'm also trying to thinking of ways to implement this one last thing for my client, urlLink ClubSoda . Jay, my contact with ClubSoda, asked me to add alot of smarts to the Members Manager I created for his websit. I should start getting to work on that, before we make the switch of the nameservers next week.... Well, until later, cya!
Guess who I currently miss bunches? Alicia Goldberger! She left yesterday morning for US Air Force Basic Training!
School's Out, Woohoo! Ok, its been out for a while, but woohoo!!!!!!! I need to find some incentive to start posting here >.
I love Alicia Goldberger!
Hello world. Life is great, ain't it? Well.. my friend Alicia I might never see again.... She is going to boot camp in 2 weeks as well. I LOVE HER SO MUCH!
Today, I transfered my blog from BlogSpot to my webspace at BellSouth Personal Web Pages. I will try to keep ya'll updated. Email Me: urlLink jhaygood86@bellsouth.net

Woohoo! My brother Jeff finally moved back to Georgia with his wife (Angie) and three kids (Elizabeth - 16, Meghan - 13, CJ - 11). Tommorow, I am going to be going to their new place and spending the night. Wish my luck. On another note, I am redesigning my website's home page at urlLink http://personalpages.bellsouth.net/j/h/jhaygood86 .
OK, I got that out of the way. Now, its really early in the morning, and I'm really worried about my buddy Jenni. I hope she's doing OK. Well, goodnight ya'll.

I'm currently figuring out how to adapt my members system I use on urlLink ClubSoda to XDG Kat-Productions. I'll figure out by this evening. I'm going to incorporate MD5 password encryption on XDG's version however. I'm also listening to The Anthem by Good Charlotte on urlLink BellSouth Internet Service Webtunes Platinum

Greatest Movie Ever Greatest movie ever: Mystic River. I absolutely loved it. Great director, Clint Eastwood. 3 great actors play the main characters, Jimmy, Sean, & Dave. Just watch it, and you'll see why I love it so much. I just got done watching it (yes, at 12:45 AM) Cross Posted on urlLink Tinsel

My friend Jenni has been refusing to talk to me recently. At least I now know (and partially understand) why. She just needed a break so that she wouldn't start hating me. I do understand that's a good reason to stop talking to me, but I still don't know why she got tired with me in the first place.... I'll find out eventually, when she feels like talking with me again. On a side note.. I am now part of the newly created urlLink Tinsel Blogging Project !

I'm bored, really bored. There is absolutely zero things that I can do. Me and mi amiga Jenni talked until like 3 AM the other day (yesterday morning). That was fun. God, is she getting beautiful. Well, she already is a beautiful girl, but she's getting more and more so everyday. I bought her a Boxcar Racer CD for her 16th birthday, even though its several months away (September 9th). My friend Meagan turns 16 soon (July 27th).. Three people I know turning 16!

Last night I got back from my niece Elizabeth's 16th birthday party. I survived quite well. It was quite fun. In fact, I'll post pictures soon for ya'll. Happy Birthday Elizabeth! I hope you enjoy 16, I know I did. Update: I have pictures! You can view them at the urlLink Photo Gallery .

Hello Everyone. If you know me, you know that I have been happily using Mandrakelinux Cooker (read: unstable, bleeding edge) for a couple of weeks. I have fallen in love (almost!) Novell Evolution 1.5 & Gaim 0.79 . Also, I finally got the nVidia Linux drivers installed. I should of checked their website more often, since they released brand new drivers (mainly to support PCI Express based GeForce cards).

I need to remember to blog more often. Well, everything here is going well. I got my learner's permit renewed. I'm a little ticked because I missed the fireworks display. It was July 3rd instead of July 4th. Darn them. Oh well, I guess there is always next year.
